@jlindsay-bluemodus
I don't think this is possible. The exception is being caught by the platform at such a high/general level - the code displaying the toast doesn't know the cause or context of the error.
If you are building a custom module UI then I'd do the validation at the point that the data is being modified. You'll have some [page command](https://docs.kentico.com/x/4ASiCQ) or [page event lifecycle method](https://docs.kentico.com/developers-and-admins/customization/extend-the-administration-interface/ui-pages/ui-pages-with-forms#data-processing) that can catch the exception thrown by the event handler and return a more helpful message.
Worst case, you can provide a lot of helpful formatted details in the Event Log error message to guide the user to help resolve the problem.
